production.title: Production process
production.description: From extraction to market: our complete vermiculite processing cycle

step1.title: In-situ vermiculite extraction
step1.description: We extract high-quality vermiculite ore from carefully managed mining sites using modern equipment and sustainable practices.

step2.title: Screening and cleaning
step2.description: Raw ore undergoes initial screening to remove large rocks and debris.

step3.title: Concentrate production
step3.description: Advanced separation techniques are used to obtain a refined vermiculite concentrate.

step4.title: Heating and expansion
step4.description: Concentrate is passed through high-temperature furnaces where the material expands up to 30 times its original volume.

step5.title: Cooling and quality control
step5.description: Expanded vermiculite is cooled and subjected to strict quality checks.

step6.title: Ready for distribution
step6.description: Final products are stored and prepared for global distribution.

whatIsVermiculite.title: What is vermiculite?
whatIsVermiculite.description1: Vermiculite is a natural mineral that expands into lightweight, accordion-like particles when heated. This unique expansion process gives the material excellent insulation, absorption, and light-weight properties.
whatIsVermiculite.description2: The expanded structure of vermiculite provides a large surface area, making it ideal for thermal insulation, water retention, and use as a lightweight aggregate. It is inert, non-toxic and fire-resistant, suitable for construction, agriculture and industrial applications.

applications.title: Industrial applications
applications.subtitle: Discover how vermiculite is used across different sectors

items.title: Construction
items.description: Used as a lightweight aggregate in concrete, tile mixes, acoustic panels and roofing materials. It provides excellent thermal insulation and reduces structural weight.
benefits: Additive for tile and plaster mixes

items.title: Agriculture and horticulture
items.description: Improves soil structure by enhancing aeration, water retention and nutrient availability. Used in seed mixes, hydroponics and greenhouses.

items.title: Insulation
items.description: Ideal for thermal insulation of buildings, industrial equipment and high-temperature applications. Its non-combustible nature makes it suitable for safe construction.

items.title: Fireproof materials
items.description: Key component in fire protection systems, fire-resistant panels, doors and coatings. It maintains structural integrity at very high temperatures.

items.title: Metallurgy and industry
items.description: Used in foundry work, metal casting and high-temperature insulation. It protects equipment and enables safe handling of molten materials.

items.title: Filtration and absorbents
items.description: An effective filtration medium for liquids and gases. Used for spill absorption, chemical containment and environmental remediation.

items.title: Lightweight
items.desc: Very low density makes it easy to handle and reduces structural loads in construction.

items.title: Fire resistant
items.desc: With a decomposition point above 1100°C, it is ideal for fire protection.

items.title: Thermal insulation
items.desc: Reduces heat transfer and improves energy efficiency in buildings.

items.title: Water retention
items.desc: Can retain 3–4 times its weight in water, beneficial for agricultural use.

items.title: Chemically inert
items.desc: Neutral pH and non-reactive properties make it safe for plants, animals and sensitive materials.

items.title: Environmentally friendly
items.desc: A natural, sustainable and non-toxic mineral with no harmful environmental impact.
